actor_awards.notes: Known as the quintessential comedic leading lady of the screwball era, she famously shunned publicity and interviews. She received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress for 'The More the Merrier' (1943).

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A cynical, street-smart secretary who initially mocks but eventually champions a naive young senator.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the U.S. Senate. His plans collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: Shane
filmography.role_description: The steadfast wife of a homesteader who finds herself drawn to the mysterious gunfighter protecting their land.
filmography.plot: A weary gunfighter attempts to settle down with a homestead family, but a smoldering settler/rancher conflict forces him to act.

filmography.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
filmography.role_description: A tough newspaper reporter who poses as a damsel in distress to get a scoop on a newly wealthy poet, only to fall for him.
filmography.plot: A small-town poet inherits a vast fortune and moves to the city, where he is beset by greed and corruption.

filmography.title: The More the Merrier
filmography.role_description: A meticulous government worker whose apartment routine is upended when she rents a room during the WWII housing shortage.
filmography.plot: During the World War II housing shortage in Washington D.C., a woman sublets half of her apartment to two men, leading to romantic complications.

filmography.title: You Can't Take It with You
filmography.role_description: The only relatively normal member of an eccentric family who falls in love with the son of a stuffy banker.
filmography.plot: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.

filmography.title: Only Angels Have Wings
filmography.role_description: A traveling entertainer stranded in South America who falls for a stoic airmail pilot.
filmography.plot: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win a contract.

filmography.title: The Devil and Miss Jones
filmography.role_description: A department store clerk who unknowingly befriends the store's tycoon owner when he goes undercover.
filmography.plot: A tycoon goes undercover in his own department store to identify agitators but ends up sympathizing with his employees.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Charles Coburn)

filmography.title: The Talk of the Town
filmography.role_description: A spirited schoolteacher who rents her attic to a Supreme Court nominee while hiding a fugitive in her cottage.
filmography.plot: An escaped prisoner and a law professor contend for the affections of a schoolteacher.

filmography.title: Easy Living
filmography.role_description: A poor working girl whose life is turned upside down when a wealthy banker throws a fur coat out a window and it lands on her.
filmography.plot: A wealthy banker throws his wife's fur coat out the window, where it lands on a poor working girl, causing everyone to believe she is his mistress.

filmography.title: A Foreign Affair
filmography.role_description: A prim Iowa congresswoman investigating morale in post-WWII Berlin who is charmed by a cynical army captain.
filmography.plot: A congressional committee visits occupied Berlin to investigate G.I. morale, where a congresswoman gets involved in a love triangle.

filmography.title: History Is Made at Night
filmography.role_description: A woman seeking a divorce from her jealous shipping magnate husband who falls in love with a headwaiter.
filmography.plot: A jealous husband frames his wife to prevent a divorce, but she falls in love with the man used in the frame-up.

filmography.title: The Whole Town's Talking
filmography.role_description: A tough-talking co-worker who helps a meek clerk mistaken for a gangster.
filmography.plot: A meek clerk who looks exactly like a notorious gangster is given a special pass by the police to avoid being arrested.

filmography.title: If You Could Only Cook
filmography.role_description: A woman who teams up with a millionaire (unbeknownst to her) to pose as a married couple working as domestics.
filmography.plot: An automobile tycoon meets a girl in the park and they decide to apply for a job as a cook and butler couple.

filmography.title: The Plainsman
filmography.role_description: A rough-and-tumble frontierswoman in love with Wild Bill Hickok.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok attempts to stop an Indian uprising supplied by gunrunners, while dealing with the affections of Calamity Jane.

filmography.title: The Ex-Mrs. Bradford
filmography.role_description: A mystery writer's ex-wife who keeps pulling him back into murder investigations.
filmography.plot: A doctor is dragged into a murder investigation by his crime-novelist ex-wife.

filmography.title: Diamond Jim
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing two women in the life of the flamboyant businessman Diamond Jim Brady.
filmography.plot: The life and times of turn-of-the-century tycoon Diamond Jim Brady.

filmography.title: Arizona
filmography.role_description: A tough pioneer woman in 1860s Arizona who builds a freight business and finds love.
filmography.plot: A strong-willed woman in the Arizona territory dreams of owning a ranch but faces corruption and outlaws.

filmography.title: A Lady Takes a Chance
filmography.role_description: A New York city girl on a bus tour of the West who falls for a rodeo cowboy.
filmography.plot: A city girl goes west looking for adventure and romance, finding both with a cowboy who isn't ready to settle down.

filmography.title: Too Many Husbands
filmography.role_description: A woman who finds herself legally married to two men when her first husband returns after being declared dead.
filmography.plot: A woman remarries after her husband is lost at sea, only for him to return alive, leading to a comedic rivalry between the two husbands.

filmography.title: Party Wire
filmography.role_description: A young woman whose reputation is nearly destroyed by small-town gossip over a party line.
filmography.plot: The local gossip mill in a small town uses the telephone party line to spread rumors that threaten a young couple's happiness.

filmography.title: Public Hero #1
filmography.role_description: The sister of a gangster who unknowingly falls in love with an undercover federal agent.
filmography.plot: An undercover agent helps a gangster escape prison to lead him to the rest of the gang, but complications arise when he falls for the gangster's sister.

filmography.title: Adventure in Manhattan
filmography.role_description: An actress who becomes involved with a crime reporter who predicts murders before they happen.
filmography.plot: A crime novelist/reporter claims he can predict crimes and tries to solve a jewelry heist involving a theatrical producer.

filmography.title: The Canary Murder Case
filmography.role_description: A suspect in the murder of a nightclub singer in this early talkie mystery.
filmography.plot: Detective Philo Vance investigates the murder of a showgirl known as 'The Canary'.

filmography.title: More Than a Secretary
filmography.role_description: A magazine editor who becomes a secretary to a fitness magazine publisher to prove a point.
filmography.plot: A co-owner of a typing school takes a job as a secretary to a health magazine editor to show how it should be done.

filmography.title: Danger Lights
filmography.role_description: The object of affection for a railroad boss in this early drama filmed in a widescreen process.
filmography.plot: A railroad division superintendent falls for a woman who is engaged to one of his engineers.
